content:
Posted: April 18, 2016
												I really don't get why so much hate on this game. It does what it says and does it nicely. The gameplay is smooth enough, graphics aren't top notch but not ugly or outdated as people say it is.You get to experience a perfect one kind of simulation:You got to take care of a forest and its differnt types of trees. Master using the machines and the money available will INCREASE a lot, helping you out on the economy side of the game. There is a nice bunch of tools and machines - from chainsaws to harvesters, cranes, trucks or tractors - at your disposal, you tend to orders and try to max your skills within different areas of the gameplay.The world where you play cicles day and night, which end to be two total different styles of play in my opinion. Concerning the graphic design of the game, I found the HUD very easy to understand and use. It is my first time playing this type of game (Forestry) so I cannot compare to the previews editions, but this one right here is a great game and I am pretty sure you won't regret getting it.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
A Woodcutting Simulator


YouTube™ Video: Forestry 2017 - The Simulation || Woodcutting Simulator 

			Views: 1,255		

			#forestry2017 http://store.steampowered.com/app/273800/ If you are wondering why I'm like the only one leaving a positive review be sure to check out the video above, as far as simulators go I...		

If you are wondering why I'm like the only one leaving a positive review be sure to check out the video above, as far as simulators go I actually had a bit more fun with this game than I probably should have. + Good country / rock soundtrack+ A nice progression system where you eventually work your way up to better vehicles, along with hiring staff and so fourth (although I didn't make it that far)+ Controls are pretty simple but everything seems to work well (I was surprised at how well the Jeep drove, even off-road it was pretty realistic)+ The map is HUGE with multiple sawmills you will never run out of trees (well...eventually you might)+ Visually it looks pretty nice, with a day/night cycle, although the houses and textures could be improved a bit.- The game feels lifeless, there is only a couple other player models besides yourself in the world- Very repetitive- Not a whole lot of content or things to do, you will grind a lot just to unlock a few vehicles that will make things slightly easier- No tutorial~ I do feel like the game could have actually been a bit more enjoyable if it supported co-op multiplayer although that's hard to expect from a simulation game.As far as simulators go this is actually pretty decent.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2016
												As I loaded my lip with Copenhagen and poured whiskey into my glass, I felt the hair on my face thicken. Long have I awaited the moment when I can become a true lumberjack. Day 1 into my new profession was simple and yet ultimate bliss. I started it all off by picking up my trusty steed sprinkles. I assume I raised the horse however the whiskey had already began to run its course altering my thought process. As we began our 35 yard adventure to the nearest tree I began to grow hair on my chest at the thought of my first kill. Without further hesitation I spam every button, eventually finding my chainsaw, and cutting the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ down Gears of War style. Defeated at last, the monster fell.The corpse, laying gently on the ground, was staring at me. With sap gushing out of its newly opened wound like a river after a heavy flood. I look back at it with nothing more than a grin, while the humming of my chainsaw was teeth rattling music to my ears. I couldn't hold back any longer I began to dismember him. Limb. by. Limb.Day 2 basically the same thing but at this point I was already way too drunk to care about the minor details.Day 3 i"m reely dunk loolThe game isn't "bad", but it's not the best thing I've ever played. It has bugs, glitches and other stuff but it plays just fine. It just needs to be polished up. It is exactly how they describe it on the store page. You cut ♥♥♥♥ing trees.If you want to support the game, buy it. If not, then don't. Simple.

number of helpful: 10 of 22 people (45%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 27, 2016
												I know this company doesn't exactly have a great reputation as far as standing behind their games and I've been pretty disappointed a couple of times myself. But in all fairness, I've played this game a short bit and it was at least "OK". It ain't exactly epic and there are things I would add to it, but I did find it entertaining so far and intend to go back and play it some more. Considering Steam's new refund policy, if you think you might like it, it might be worth a try because you can always get your money back. A lot depends on what you think you expect the game to be... It's pretty basic and uncomplicated. At least I haven't found any glaring bugs or anything like that yet.I'd describe the game as a basic simulation in which you start off with a horse (with single log trailer) and a chainsaw. It seems like you can pretty much fall any tree in sight of the town you start in, saw it into 4 sections, then haul each section (one-by-one) back to the lumber mill for money. There's a light RPG element as you gain experience/level for selling logs, for which you get a point to allocate toward a skill (higher selling prices for logs, cheaper equipment prices, etc.).I've only gotten so far in the game as of this review, but after level 3, you can buy a garage (which opens up the ability to buy tractors and other logging equipment... Couldn't afford them yet myself). A level 6 you can buy an office to accept contracts and so on. In higher levels, it appears (I haven't got that far yet) that you can hire employees, possibly buy the lumber mill, make stuff to sell there, etc.Anyway, I think this game may suit some, but not others. For me, I give it a tentative thumbs up, subject to change. I know buying again from this company is scary, I almost didn't do it either. But so far, even though there's things I think they could/should add, I do like it better than anything else I've bought from them. And I haven't seen much about the game itself except people angry at the company for past burns (rightfully so). So, I thought I'd try to post something informative to help those on the fence. Good luck with your choice.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 2, 2016
Product received for free
												Pros: It's a pretty straight forward game with control suggestions in the lower right corner, which I liked. It was a good click-then-achievement type game, especially where people are interested in linear goals and clear-cut objectives. I liked the wavy grass! The physics could be quite entertaining in the game. I count this as a pro because it provided some comic relief. Who knows where the tree's going next?!?! NO ONE! Cons: The lighting at night was pitch black, which most games there's SOME lighting so you can make sure you're not walking into walls and stuff...I'd recommend a bit more ambient lighting. The controls could use a little work. My poor horse got stuck going in circles a lot. :( Poor horsie. I think if the vehicles didn't get stuck in a perpetual circle motion occassionally the controls would be just fine.
